definition: person who represents an organization and enhances its image/ambassador
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: We want them to be ambassadors for their country, the minister added.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望他們成爲英國的形象大使。

sentences.english: As Man Wenjun still acts as image ambassador, should he be blocked or saved?
sentences.chinese: 滿文軍仍任形象大使，該封殺還是救贖？

sentences.english: Win the first place in the Colledge English Festival , be conferred the title of Image Ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 院英語節比賽獲得第一名並授予形象大使稱號。

sentences.english: China Red Ribbon Foundation ambassador Bai Yansong said.
sentences.chinese: 中華紅絲帶基金形象大使白巖松說。

sentences.english: She was also an ambassador for the 2008 Olympic games in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 楊瀾是北京2008奧運會的形象大使。

sentences.english: The campaign features Takeshi Kaneshiro, Lipton's ambassador for the last two years.
sentences.chinese: 廣告活動代言人金城武，是立頓過去兩年的形象大使。

sentences.english: Qin Bing won seven dimensional princess series image ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 秦冰榮獲七度空間公主系列的形象大使。

sentences.english: Every people in Shanghai is the city's image ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 每個上海人都是城市的形象大使。

sentences.english: He was appointed as the image ambassador of the philanthropic activity.
sentences.chinese: 他被委任爲此次慈善活動的形象大使。

definition: to be a spokesperson/to be an ambassador (for a brand)/to endorse
